intro: Papaver bellum, commonly known as the Persian poppy, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from deep red to orange and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features smooth, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
